sari9: 5 cups of water or chicken broth
sariTarif1: Wash and drain the yellow lentils.
sariTarif2: In a pot, heat the oil or butter and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
sariTarif3: Add the chopped carrots and potatoes, sauté for a few minutes.
sariTarif4: Add the washed yellow lentils to the pot and stir.
sariTarif5: Add salt, black pepper, and cumin, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
sariTarif6: Once boiling, reduce the heat and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are completely tender.
sariTarif7: Blend the soup until smooth using a blender or immersion blender. If the soup is too thick, you can add more water.

sariTarif9: Serve hot with lemon slices. Enjoy!

nohutlu5: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
nohutluTarif1: Soak the rice in salted warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then rinse and drain well.

nohutluTarif3: Add the cooked chickpeas and stir.
nohutluTarif4: Add salt and black pepper, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.

kuru5: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
kuruTarif1: Soak the dried beans in a bowl covered with plenty of water overnight. If short on time, you can quickly boil them instead.
kuruTarif2: Place the boiled and drained beans in a pot. Add enough hot water to cover them and stir.
kuruTarif3: Heat the vegetable oil or butter in a pan. Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
kuruTarif4: Add the tomato paste and continue to cook, then add the tomatoes.
kuruTarif5: Add the spices and optional red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring occasionally.
kuruTarif6: Add this mixture to the cooked beans and stir.
kuruTarif7: Cover the pot and simmer on low heat until the beans are tender. This usually takes about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remember to stir occasionally.
kuruTarif8: Once the beans are tender and the sauce has thickened, remove from heat.
kuruTarif9: Serve hot with rice and pickles. Enjoy your meal!
